qas.question: What insect is the most destructive pest in cotton growing in the US?
What program has effectively eliminated the boll weevil in the US?
What is the organization that instigated the Boll Weevil Eradication Program?
What form of cotton contains a genetically modified gene?
On what does the use of Bt cotton reduce reliance?
What insect is the most destructive pest in cotton growing in the BWEP?
What program has effectively eliminated pests in the US?
What is the organization that instigated the boll weevil?
What form of cotton contains a genetically modified pest?
On what does the use of BWEP reduce reliance?

context: Historically, in North America, one of the most economically destructive pests in cotton production has been the <a0_0><b5_0>boll weevil<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Due to the <a2_0><b7_0>US Department of Agriculture<b7_0/><a2_0/>'s highly successful <a1_0><b6_0>Boll Weevil Eradication Program<b6_0/><a1_0/> (BWEP), this pest has been eliminated from cotton in most of the United States. This program, along with the introduction of genetically engineered <a3_0><b8_0>Bt cotton<b8_0/><a3_0/> (which contains a bacterial gene that codes for a plant-produced protein that is toxic to a number of pests such as cotton bollworm and pink bollworm), has allowed a reduction in the use of <a4_0><b9_0>synthetic insecticides<b9_0/>.
